title: Whoopi Goldberg Joins ‘Sister Act’ Musical Revival Cast
text:
Sing out, Whoopi. Photo: Buena Vista Pictures

There’s stunt casting, and then there’s casting the star of a movie that came out 27 years ago in a revival of a musical based on that movie that’ll start performances next year. Whoopi Goldberg, star of the 1992 movie Sister Act, is going to lead the cast of a London production of the musical Sister Act, which first ran in Pasadena in 2006, before going to London in 2009, and coming to Broadway in 2011. Goldberg will still play Deloris Van Cartier, the lounge singer who goes into hiding as a nun, in the London revival, alongside Absolutely Fabulous’s Jennifer Saunders as the Mother Superior. The production will run from July 29 to August 30, 2020, at London’s Eventim Apollo theater. “Yeah, the original Deloris is back,” Whoopi says in a video interview, “a little older, a little seasoned, but really still kind of out there.” Joyful, Joyful news! Wait, sorry, that’s Sister Act 2.
description: Whoopi Goldberg is starring in a revival of the musical “Sister Act” in London, playing the same role she played in the movie “Sister Act.”
